titleStmt.title: A perfect relation of the beginning and continuation of the Irish-rebellion, from May last, to this present 12th , of January, 1641 with the place where and persons who did plot, contrive, and put in execution that Romish damnable designe : as also their inhumane cruelties which they have and still execute with divellish hatred upon the Protestants / written by a worthy Gentleman and sent over by a merchant now dwelling in Dublin ; whereunto is annexed the merchants letter who sent the copy of this relation : with another letter wherein is truely related the battell fought betwixt our English and the Rebels on the tenth of January as a town called Swords eight miles from Dublin.
titleStmt.author: Jones, Henry, 1605-1682.
P. G., Merchant now dwelling in Dublin.

notesStmt.note: The relation was written by "Dean Jones of Kilmore," i.e. Henry Jones, the Bishop of Meath.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
